title: Allow quickpick to be dismissed via mouse
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.35.0
- OS Version: OS X Yosemite (Version 10.10.5)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open up Visual Studio Code and open up a folder that has been initialized to be a Git repository.
2. Click on the branch checkout button at the very bottom left of the window
![vscode-checkout-btn ](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15806388/59172436-e8ee0d80-8b15-11e9-9ab1-ea306d11257c.png)
3. A dropdown list of branches will appear, you cannot click on any other part of the application to try to close the dropdown list. It can only be closed by hitting the esc key.
![vscode-branch-list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15806388/59172441-eb506780-8b15-11e9-8dc2-954f6f882fcd.png)
If I remember correctly, I encountered this issue with the command palate dropdown as well with a previous version of Visual Studio Code. It has been fixed and I can exit the command palate dropdown now by clicking away from the dropdown. I hoped to find an issue report for the past issue as it could be helper for the developers,  unfortunately, I could not find an issue report on this topic.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Editor Smart Zoom
body:
An "Editor Smart Zoom" setting would be useful, such that it would auto-set the editor zoom level based on:

1) the maximum line length (character-based) in a document
2) the width of the current Window

title: "Terminal: Clear" not working as desired

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run a python file using command palette >Python: Run file in terminal window 2. Terminal shows the output. Now, clear the terminal using command palette >Terminal: Clear 3. Terminal gets clear now. Run the file again in the terminal >Python: Run file in terminal window 4. Here is where issue shows up - the terminal still shows all the previous outputs from before the last clear command. IMO, desired should be that terminal should not show any previously cleared outputs. 5. Attached below is a gif of the screen reproducing & visualizing this issue ![Screenshot PC - 072 - 2019_06_08_1016](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4213286/59149740-9eb24280-89d6-11e9-8563-cc694c4e04b3.gif) Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes, the issue reoccurs. (Note: All except the "Python" extension were disabled. Python extension is needed to run the python file in terminal. I had also posted in Super User forum thinking this was some issue with my system. And then I tried it on a clean build of VS code and it got repeated. Hence, I decided to post it as a bug. [Link to Super User forum question](https://superuser.com/questions/1446320/vs-code-terminal-clear-command-not-working-as-desired) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.36.0-insider (c089daa858f34631f5f827ff8a0313bf1e2ded6d, 2019-06-07T05:19:15.188Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

title: Add clickable colour swatches that show the colour picker when clicked on
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Typically to open the colour picker in VS Code when doing CSS, you simply hover your cursor over the colour value and let it show up. However, if you hover or click on the colour swatch to the left of the colour value, it will do nothing other than positioning the cursor next to it.

In Visual Studio Code's Interactive Playground, the CSS tip below the first small editor window mentioned: "These swatches also act as colour pickers that allow you to easily change a colour value." However, the swatches do nothing other than to show colour. If that is the case, wouldn't it be better to say that "these swatches preview colour..."?

So, I would suggest allowing the colour picker to be shown when clicking the colour swatches (also would suggest using the "Link Select" (or the hand) cursor to indicate something clickable).
The same colour picker can still be shown when hovering above the colour value, since hovering over stuff should show quick info.

title: editor.trimAutoWhitespace trims manually inserted whitespaces
body:
Set `editor.trimAutoWhitespace` to true.

Try to create a text file of 10 lines, each one having a tab inside it.

You can't.

- Lines must contain exactly one tab and nothing else
- All extension disabled
- To test, save the file and use `cat -e` to check if the lines contain tabs
- Does not matter whether tabs are spaces or not
- `editor.autoIndent` does not change anything

**The problem**
Trailing whitespaces that are manually inserted are trimmed.

**Possible solutions**
1. Rename `editor.trimAutoWhitespace` to `editor.trimWhitespace`
2. Do not trim manually inserted whitespaces and have a separate setting for them

<details>
<summary>Version Info</summary>
VS Code version: Code 1.35.0 (553cfb2c2205db5f15f3ee8395bbd5cf066d357d, 2019-06-04T01:13:26.790Z)
OS version: Linux x64 4.15.0-51-generic

Extensions: none
</details>
<!-- generated by issue reporter -->

title: Add git status decorations to icons in sidebar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I like using monochrome icon themes, because otherwise the abundance of colours becomes too distracting.

However, it would be great if the icons could take on the colour of the git decoration of the file.

Observe this difference between VSCode and Atom:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/490562/59136605-f7360f80-89d7-11e9-911e-f52b3a428e25.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/490562/59136615-09b04900-89d8-11e9-820d-d92903e14583.png)

Because the icons are coloured as well, providing a larger area of contrasting colour, it becomes visually much more obvious which files are modified and which aren't. 

Would be great if VSCode could adopt this, or if an icon theme could somehow implement this.

title: String visualizer for text variables
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
The same feature that visual studio has as shown in this link https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/debugger/string-visualizer-dialog-box?view=vs-2019

But it may not be a high demand feature. I personally want it to check formatting, etc.

title: Return me to the last line of any reverted change
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Step 0. Version 1.35.0 with extensions disabled.
Step 1. Open a file with changes committed in git
Step 2. Use ALT+F3 to navigate to the next change in-line
Step 3. Click Revert Change 
Step 4. find the line number you were on and move your cursor there, then hit ALT+F3 again

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I would like vscode to remember where I was whenever I revert a change, then return me to that place, so that I can see the change disappear and so that I can proceed using hotkey to the next change.

title: APPLICATION_INSIGHTS_NO_DIAGNOSTIC_CHANNEL set to "true" for launch configs
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.35
- OS Version: MacOS 10.14.5

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

I noticed that my Application Insight auto dependency collection wasn't working with my NodeJS application. I'm fairly confident it was previously working, but didn't appear to be now - although I'm not sure when it stopped.

I noticed that `APPLICATION_INSIGHTS_NO_DIAGNOSTIC_CHANNEL` was set to `"false"` which disables AI's auto dependency collection. There is no where in my code or config setting this, so I tried manually setting it to "false" in my run configuration and behold, it worked.

Searching the VS Code codebase turns up https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/03a9aca859485979f20b9f037587310aced33eab/src/bootstrap.js#L301 where the environment variable is set.

It appears that this environment variable is propagated to processes spawned from launch configs, which is less than desirable and certainly caused me a good deal of confusion.

It would be nice if users didn't have to manually set this environment variable, given that AI's default is for it to be enabled.

title: WebView: mouse drag does not stop when within webview region

title: Developing inside a container on a remote Docker host
body:
I have read [Developing inside a container on a remote Docker host](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/containers-advanced#_developing-inside-a-container-on-a-remote-docker-host).

Is it feasible that combine the Remote-SSH and Remote-Containers?

Two vscode servers. 

One vscode server runs on remote docker host. Source code, `devcontainer.json` and `Dockerfile` are saved in remote host.

The other runs in container for code intellisense, running and debugging

title: Option for auto closing comments
body:
This is an implementation of feature requested in #1966.

The option itself was added in a complete inspiration of `autoClosingBraces` and `autoClosingQuotes` and it's in a separate commit to ease review of actual feature implementation.

Not entirely happy with the logic implementation, but there is already quite convoluted interaction between checks in `_isAutoClosingOpenCharType` and `_typeInterceptorElectricChar`.

Wend with a way which minimizes amount of changes between those two.

The biggest challenge fitting this new functionality into existing `_isAutoClosing*` functions is that they are currently designed to work with a single character pairs. While it's possible to make them aware of multi-character ones, it is still seems changes to `_typeInterceptorElectricChar()` are needed. And this is where some entanglement begins.

Really looking forward having feedback from a core developers to find solution which fits design in a best possible way.

milestone.title: Backlog

title: Rubber Band Pin
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Add a feature where I can add a pin to a line in code, make it easy like hold a key and click to pin. That way I can scroll up or down, and with a key press bounce back to where I was.

title: Setting Quickpick.items with canSelectMany doesn't clear the selectedItems
Support object types in `when` conditions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This PR implements #74699 

This change allows the `contextValue` property on a `TreeItem` to have `any` type, rather than just `string`. The value is added to the `Context` under the `viewItem` key as before. The implementation of `Context.getValue` has been updated to treat `a.b.c` as a lookup of the key `a` followed by accesses to the `b` property on `a` and the `c` property on the result of `a.b`.

**Backward compatibility concerns**
Are there existing context keys that contain `.`, other than for `config.*`, which is handled in a special `IContext` implementation?

**Testing**
I have not yet implemented any tests for the new feature. It appears that there are existing contextKey tests, but only for the expression parser and evaluator. Should I just add more tests for `Context`? Or should I test this some other way?

title: Save width of Explorer column (sidebar) in Workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:

If not I thought that (simple sounding) idea might be considered to be added to saved settings for the saved workspace. 
Thanks for listening and your consideration and or help.
Note: I tried to find a setting or reference but seem unable. Please forgive me if I missed it.

title: Add option to quick open files in edit mode instead of preview
body: It would be convenient to be able to open files directly in Edit mode instead of Preview mode via Quick Open on a per-file basis. I'm aware of the `enablePreviewFromQuickOpen` setting, but I'd like to have a keyboard` shift+enter`/`shift+click` command to toggle that behavior temporarily while quick opening a file. In other words, whatever `enablePreviewFromQuickOpen` is set to, if I hold `shift` down I could get the inverse behavior for that file.

title: Support aligned icons (octicons) in quickpicks
body:
Using octicons in quick picks is rather ugly because the icons and text are not aligned. Is it possible to have some way to align these (for ex. by making the icon a real property that will always appear to the left and be consistent width for all items in the list)?

![Screenshot 2019-06-06 at 4 55 59 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1078012/59047584-0e5fea80-887c-11e9-8d70-be093a0f02d0.png)

title: Allow to show status bar entries with an id and name
body:
This would allow us to hide/show individual entries from an extension to the status bar as opposed to hiding them all. 

**PS:** this concept may be useful also for notifications to allow fine grained filtering.

title: Extend Extension API with QuickPickSeparator Support
body:
With #21244 QuickPick Controls got the support for separators. This functionality is currently not available through the extensions API. For a nice look and feel, it would be great to make the separators available for extensions.

It seams to be not to hard to implement and I'am willing to do it, but I'am not sure from an API standpoint. Would you accept such a change?

The API could be changed in to ways:
- Add a property to the QuickPickItem to show a seperator above, add this seperator in the main thread.
- Add a Interface QuickPickSeparator to the extension api and change all occurrences of `items` to `(T | QuickPickSeparator)[]` or `ReadonlyArray<T | QuickPickSeparator>`
